item.title: PRSice-2 Polygenic Risk Score software for biobank-scale data
Detecting and Controlling for Biased Sampling in Case/Control PRS Studies

item.description: Shing Wan Choi is a Postdoctoral Fellow working under Dr Paul F. O’Reilly at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. Previously working in the SGDP Centre of King’s College London, he implemented PRSice-2, a polygenic risk score software that can be applied to biobank-scale data. His research interests include developing methods to improve prediction of polygenic risk score and to incorporate functional information to risk prediction.
